item.title: [CENTUM] Centum Electronics Sharpens Strategic Focus, Exits Loss-Making Canadian Operations, and Plans Restructuring of French Subsidiaries
item.description:

Centum Electronics Limited, a leading Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) company, has announced strategic actions to sharpen its focus on high-growth, high-reliability electronics opportunities and strengthen its financial foundation. This includes the discontinuation of loss-making operations in Canada and the restructuring of French subsidiaries. The company is streamlining its global footprint to reinforce its long-term strategy of building scale and leadership in advanced defence, space and aerospace systems, and Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS).

  • Centum Electronics is exiting its loss-making operations in Canada.
  • The company is planning to restructure its French subsidiaries, considering options like divestment, sale, or transfer of businesses, and judicial reorganisation.
  • These actions are part of Centum's ongoing portfolio optimization and disciplined capital allocation strategy.
  • Centum Electronics continues to experience robust growth in its core ESDM business in India.
  • The company is focusing on high-reliability electronics products and services, and expanding its EMS business across new products, customers, and segments.

item.title: [IGIL] International Gemmological Institute India Ltd Completes Acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by Subsidiary
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

International Gemmological Institute India Ltd (IGI India) has announced the completion of the acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by its step-down wholly owned subsidiary, International Gemmological Institute Inc (IGI USA). This acquisition was initially approved by the Board of Directors of IGI India in January 2026 and involved an investment in International Gemmological Institute BV (IGI Belgium), a wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI India, and investment by IGI Belgium in IGI USA. The acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc from Christopher P Smith and Helene Smith has resulted in AGL Holdco becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA and a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI Belgium and IGI India. Additionally, American Gemological Laboratories, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AGL Holdco, has become a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA, IGI Belgium, and IGI India.

  • International Gemmological Institute India Ltd completes the acquisition of AGL Holdco Inc by its step-down wholly owned subsidiary, International Gemmological Institute Inc
  • AGL Holdco Inc becomes wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA and step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI Belgium and IGI India
  • American Gemological Laboratories, LLC becomes a step-down wholly-owned subsidiary of IGI USA, IGI Belgium, and IGI India

item.title: [SPICEISL] Spice Islands Industries Ltd. exempted from Regulation 23(9) of SEBI (LODR) Regulation for Q1 2025
item.description:
Spice Islands Industries Limited, with a paid-up share capital of Rs. 4,30,00,000/- (Rupees Four Crores Thirty Lakhs Only) and a net worth of Rs. 2,35,70,000/- (Rupees Two Crore Thirty Five Lakhs Seventy Thousand Only) as on March 31, 2025, is exempted from the applicability of Regulation 23(9) of SEBI (LODR) Regulation for the quarter ended December 31, 2025. This exemption is due to the company's paid-up share capital and net worth being less than Rs. 10 Crores and Rs. 25 Crores, respectively. Consequently, the company is not required to submit 'Disclosures of the Related Party Transactions' as per Regulation 23(9) of the Listing Regulations.

item.title: [SHRIGANG] Shri Gang Industries Amends Code of Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information
item.description:
Shri Gang Industries & Allied Products Ltd. has amended its Code of practices and procedures for Fair Disclosure of Unpublished Price Sensitive Information under Regulation 8(1) read with Schedule A of SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 2015. The amendments have been approved by the Board at its meeting held on February 14, 2026. The Code aims to formulate a stated framework and policy for fair disclosure of events and occurrences that could probably have an impact in the price discovery, in the market for securities of the Company. The amended Code and every amendment thereto shall be promptly intimated to the stock exchanges where the securities are listed to promote transparency amongst the investors.

item.description:

The report was submitted in accordance with Regulation 32(6) of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 and Regulation 162A of SEBI (Issue of Capital and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2018.
